title.narrative: OUTPUT 14: KINDERGARTEN EDUCATION

description.narrative: Operational frameworks for improved kindergarten service delivery in place and implemented at national and subnational level., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more girls and boys in Ghana are supported to complete quality and inclusive basic education with improved learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Operational frameworks for improved kindergarten service delivery in place and implemented at national and subnational level.

description.narrative: Government through the MoE/GES with support from UNICEF launched the ECE Policy and inaugurated the National ECE Steering Committee for implementation oversight.; The process has strengthened ECE coordination and fed in the ECCD-Policy review process, providing a strong multi-sectoral-technical-working-group in UNICEF and amongst implementing partners, and shaping the review process, informed by the ECCD-policy-evaluation-findings.; A guideline developed for families/community-engagements has been validated, and key messages developed as part of the national advocacy-strategy-package for engagement, particularly at the local-level. Distance-learning-programmes targeted at mothers and children in/out of school through radio/community engagement were established to support continuous-learning among young children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2021
